attributes.action: Employees own their State Pensions so Government can't describe it as a benefit
attributes.additional_details: Please refer to the plight of the ladies born in the 1950's.  Our Plight - our fight - our Right - you won't wear our resolve down!
attributes.background: The employer and employee have contributed to the State Pension so it belongs to the employee NOT the Government and therefore can't be called a Benefit and the government should not withhold payment to the employee.  This would be deemed a criminal offence if attempted by any other party!

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because we aren't sure what action you would like the UK Government or Parliament to take.

You might like to sign this petition instead:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/263615
